actions.in_committee: House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs. H. Rept. 101-20.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 12.
Mr. Vento moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Mr. Lightfoot demanded a second on the motion to suspend the rules.
On ordering a second Agreed to without objection.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston under the authority of the order of May 18, 89 without amendment. With written report No. 101-35.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 73.
Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.
Cleared for White House.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 101-40.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands
Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks and Forests

official_title: To correct an error in Private Law 100-29 (relating to certain lands in Lamar County, Alabama).

summary.text: Amends Private Law 100-29 to make corrections relating to certain lands in Lamar County, Alabama. Amends the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act to make technical corrections relating to the renumbering of specified wild and scenic rivers. Amends the Arizona-Idaho Conservation Act of 1988 to make technical corrections regarding the Mississippi National River and Recreation Area. Amends the Military Lands Withdrawal Act of 1986 to correct "Barry M. Goldwater Air Force Base" to read "Luke Air Force Base" as a depository for certain maps and legal descriptions of public lands withdrawn for military purposes.

titles.title: To correct an error in Private Law 100-29 (relating to certain lands in Lamar County, Alabama).
